newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Leighton sees loss from IPCO sale.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Leighton sees loss from IPCO sale.

text.p: Construction and mining contractor Leighton Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday it would book an abnormal loss from the sale of its 29.6 percent stake in Singapore construction group IPCO International Ltd.

A Leighton spokesman said Leighton had the IPCO stake in its books at US$2.80 per share. The stake was sold for US$2.40 per share, raising US$28.15 million, but producing a loss of US$4.60 million or about A$5.8 million, he said.
The spokesman said the abnormal loss would not affect its pre-abnormals net profit and would be booked in the six months period to December 31.
The spokesman said the funds raised from the IPCO sale would be used mainly to retire debt.
Leighton's IPCO stake was sold to Promet Bhd, which now holds about 59.2 percent of IPCO.
